definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: We use ' have' with a plural pronoun or noun.
sentences.chinese: 與複數代名詞或名詞連用。

sentences.english: The NRSV does not change masculine pronouns referring to God, however.
sentences.chinese: 在NRSV沒有改變男性化的代名詞，來指稱上帝。

sentences.english: Women sometimes have a reputation for being worriers.
sentences.chinese: 女人有時是擔憂的代名詞。

sentences.english: Apple Records instantaneously became synonymous with Beatles records.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果唱片馬上成爲披頭四唱片的代名詞。

sentences.english: Blu-ray water drum, a synonym for fashion trend.
sentences.chinese: 藍光水鼓，一個前沿風尚的代名詞。

sentences.english: The aim of this paper is to make a comparative study of the reflexive pronouns in Mandarin Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 本論文主旨在在比較漢語和英語中的反身代名詞。

sentences.english: "Female fist hand " become for a time " cruel " pronominal.
sentences.chinese: “女拳手”一度成爲“酷”的代名詞。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，停滯不前成了這個文明古國的代名詞。

sentences.english: From then on, " your hand "has become synonymous with enduring love of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 從此，“執子之手”成了生死不渝的愛情的代名詞。

sentences.english: South Pole the ice is the pronoun of" sanctity" in some American public.
sentences.chinese: 南極冰在一些美國人心中爲“聖潔”的代名詞。

sentences.english: Synonymous with Wurth tools and supplies has always been the best quality.
sentences.chinese: 伍爾特工具及耗材歷來都是最佳質量的代名詞。

sentences.english: Wedgwood, stands for the world's most exquisite porcelain.
sentences.chinese: 偉吉伍德，是世界上最精巧的瓷器，檔次的代名詞。

sentences.english: Your short-term goals are very important because they are synonymous with action.
sentences.chinese: 你的短期目標非常重要，因爲它是行動的代名詞。

sentences.english: Refuse to misuse the word "liberal" as a synonym for socialism.
sentences.chinese: 拒絕將“自由主義者”這個詞作爲社會主義的代名詞。

sentences.english: Damage is the name of the Mage game, and they do it well.
sentences.chinese: 傷害就是法師的代名詞，而他們也做得很好。

sentences.english: In just a few years, Yunlin's Kukeng has become synonymous with Taiwan's coffee industry.
sentences.chinese: 才幾年光景，雲林古坑已經是臺灣咖啡的代名詞。

definition: not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
first choice/premium/to come first in the imperial examinations
